## Results

```{r single-sample-figures, include = FALSE}

name_and_bic <- function(name, mod) {
  k <- length(extract_knots(mod)$knots)
  return(paste(name, "~'(Knots: ", k, ", BIC: ", round(BIC(mod)), ")'", sep = ""))
}

plot_curves_and_observations <- function(d, f_curve, mod0, mod1, curve_name) {
  n = 250

  boundaries <- extract_knots(mod1)$Boundary.knots
    
  #x <- seq(from = min(boundaries[[1]]), to = max(boundaries[[2]]), length.out = n)
  x <- seq(from = min(d$Independent), to = max(d$Independent), length.out = n)  
  y <- unlist(lapply(x, f_curve))
  d_x <- data.frame(Independent = x)


  d_o <- d_x %>% filter(between(Independent, boundaries[[1]], boundaries[[2]]))
  n_o <- nrow(d_o)
  y0 <- predict(mod0, newdata = d_o)
  y1 <- predict(mod1, newdata = d_o)

  true_label <- "'True'"
  a0_label <- name_and_bic("a[1]", mod0)
  a1_label <- name_and_bic("a[2]", mod1)

  d2 <- data.frame("Independent" = x, "Dependent" = y, "Curves" = replicate(n, true_label))
  d2 <- rbind(d2, data.frame("Independent" = d_o$Independent, "Dependent" = y0, "Curves" = replicate(n_o, a0_label)))
  d2 <- rbind(d2, data.frame("Independent" = d_o$Independent, "Dependent" = y1, "Curves" = replicate(n_o, a1_label)))

  d2$Curves <- factor(d2$Curves,
                      levels = c(true_label, a0_label, a1_label))

  fig <- ggplot(d2, aes(Independent, Dependent))
  fig <- fig + force_panelsizes(rows = unit(2.28, "in"), cols = unit(3.7, "in"))  
  fig <- fig + theme_bw()
  fig <- fig + geom_point(data = d, aes(Independent, Dependent), shape = 1, color = "gray60", size = 1)  
  fig <- fig + scale_linetype_manual(values = c("solid", "twodash", "solid"),
                     labels = parse_format()(c(true_label, a0_label, a1_label)))
  fig <- fig + scale_color_manual(values = c("gray80", "black", "black"),
                     labels = parse_format()(c(true_label, a0_label, a1_label)))
  fig <- fig + scale_size_manual(values=c(1, 0.5, 0.5),
                     labels = parse_format()(c(true_label, a0_label, a1_label)))
  fig <- fig + geom_line(aes(linetype = Curves, color = Curves, size = Curves))
  fig <- fig + geom_vline(xintercept = boundaries)
  fig <- fig + guides(shape = "none")
  fig <- fig + theme(legend.position = "top",
                     legend.justification = c("left","top"),
                     legend.box.just = "left",
                     legend.title = element_blank(),
                     legend.margin = margin(0, 0, 0, 0),
                     legend.spacing.x = unit(0, "mm"),
                     legend.spacing.y = unit(0, "mm"))
  fig <- fig + ggtitle("Example True and Fitted Curves")
  fig <- fig + xlab(parse_format()("'Predictor'~X[p]")) 
  fig <- fig + ylab(parse_format()("'Response'~X[r]"))

  return(fig)
}
```

## Example data set and models

```{r, include = FALSE}
f_noise <- function(xs) {
  return(rnorm(length(xs), 0, 0.1))
}

f_signal <- function(x, curve_name) {
  y <- switch(curve_name,
         "Trigonometric" = cos(pi * x),
         "Logistic" = 1 / (1 + exp(27 - 12*x)),
         "Runge" = 1 / (1 + (x - 2)^2),
         "Quintic" = ((4/3)*x - 5)*((4/3)*x - 4)*((4/3)*x - 3)*((4/3)*x - 2)*((4/3)*x-1))
    return(y)
}

f_x_dist  <- function(n) {
  return(rlnorm(n, meanlog = 0.5, sdlog = 0.35))
}

generate_example_data <- function(n, curve_name) {
  f_signal_curried <- f_signal %-<% curve_name
  d <- generate_data(n, 2, 2, f_x_dist, f_signal_curried, f_noise)
  return(d)
}
```

```{r}
#seed <- 2
#curve_name <- "Trigonometric"

#seed <- 2
#curve_name <- "Logistic"

#seed <- 1
#curve_name <- "Runge"

seed <- 4
curve_name <- "Quintic"


set.seed(seed)

d <- generate_example_data(250, curve_name)

d_o <- d %>% filter(between(Independent, quantile(Independent, .05), quantile(Independent, .95)))

max_knots <- 4
suggested_cnt <- cladina::suggest_knotcount(d_o, Dependent, Independent, max_knots, stats::BIC)
m0 <- model_by_count(d_o, Dependent, Independent, suggested_cnt$nknots)
m1 <- choose_splines(d_o, Dependent, Independent,  max_nknots = max_knots, icr_fn = stats::BIC)$model
```

```{r plot-curves, echo = FALSE}
fig <- plot_curves_and_observations(d, f_signal_curried, m0, m1, curve_name)

```
